top_categories.workout_context: 83ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
Karukinka's Chilean Tierra del Fuego, South American gravel forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 120 miles.
At Karukinka, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Karukinka's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before February.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Karukinka. Train it until it feels boring.
At mile 60 of 120, glycogen is gone. This workout teaches your body to produce watts on fumes.
10,000ft of climbing on grades that change every minute. You need to switch from seated to standing without losing rhythm.
10,000ft of climbing means repeated surges above threshold. VO2max work is how you survive the fifth climb, not just the first.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Karukinka, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
Every hard session works better with a bigger aerobic base. At 120 miles, base fitness is the difference between racing and surviving.
Low-cadence force work for 10,000ft of climbing. The slow, grinding ascents where you can't spin—you push.
Short, max efforts are unavoidable. Punchy climbs, gap closures, attacks on tierra del Fuego mountain gravel. If you haven't trained them, you'll crack.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for Karukinka’s 120 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.altitude: Moderate altitude at Karukinka. Arrive 2–3 days early. Reduce intensity expectations by 5–10%. Hydrate aggressively.
race_overlay.terrain: Highly technical terrain at Karukinka demands practice on similar surfaces. Ride tierra del fuego mountain gravel at race-day cadence weekly. Expect: chilean tierra del fuego, south american gravel, regional event. Practice cornering, descending, and power delivery on unstable surfaces. Dial in tire pressure before race week — 5 PSI wrong costs you 15+ minutes over 120 miles.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on TT Threshold, Gravel Specific, and Over Under to prepare you for 120 miles of tierra del fuego mountain gravel in Tierra del Fuego, Chile.
